title: looking for something similar to Meta
content:
hello,

i’m looking for a font that is similar to [Meta](http://web.archive.org/web/20090918230229/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&font_categories_search=font_name_search&searchstr=meta&image.x=15&image.y=10) to use for a logotype, but [something a little more obscure]... if anyone has any suggestions, they woud be greatly appreciated.

thank you in advance.

——————————————————-  
nc
author: istitch

comments.content: Officina Sans could be nice. You could always go in and sharpen the corners of each glyph. Unit too. So many in this genre.

Gracias, these suggestions are great! decisions, decisions...  
: )

—————-  
nc

thanks,

————————  
nc

btw  
i edited the original post because i don’t want to dis Meta. i think it’s used so much because it’s a really nice typeface… i just want to avoid using such a well known face for a logotype.

If you want something more characteristic, you might even like Sophisto ?

[http://www.macrhino.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20090918230229/http:/www.macrhino.com/ "http://www.macrhino.com")

thanks Stefan! Sophisto is beautiful.

i wasn’t able to find a typesetter on your site or the ditribution site. is there any way for us to see a certain phrase typeset in Sophisto before we purchase the font?
